definitions: To preserve food, typically by canning or pickling.
To offer something for sale or auction.
To display or post something, such as a notice or sign.
To nominate someone for an election or position.
examples: They will put up a new building.
Can you put me up for the night?
She likes to put up her own jam.
I can't put up with that noise.
The house was put up for sale.
He put up a notice about the meeting.
They put him up for president.
